World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: Oil is found in petroliferous rock. Which one among the following structures demonstrates an ideal trap?
World Geography.explanation: Fault trap is a kind of structural trap.Here, the fracture and slippage of rock along a fault line may bring an impermeable stratum in contact with a layer of permeable reservoir rock and thus forms a barrier to petroleum migration.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: Which one among the following statements is not correct?
options: Solar noon occurs simultaneously at locations with the same longitude
One meridian, which is directly under the Sun, experiences solar noon at a given time
Places having same longitude experience solar noon at different times
Solar noon occurs at different times at locations with the same latitude
World Geography.answer: One meridian, which is directly under the Sun, experiences solar noon at a given time
World Geography.explanation: Places having same longitude experience solar moon at different times.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: The westerlies have their origin in the
World Geography.explanation: The westerlies generally blow between 30° and 60° latitude in both the Northern and Southern hemispheres from the west towards the east. These winds are thus called westerly winds, after the direction from whence the winds come.It blows below the subtropical highs in the Southern Hemisphere.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: Mid-latitude cyclones
options: usually move across North-America from East to West
are generally found only over the ocean
generally bring clear skis and little precipitation
are formed in regions of strong temperature contrasts
World Geography.answer: are formed in regions of strong temperature contrasts
World Geography.explanation: Mid-latitude or frontal cyclones are large travelling atmospheric cyclonic storms up to 2000 kilometres in diameter with centres of low atmospheric pressure. The jet stream plays a major role in the location of mid-latitude cyclones.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: In soil, water that, is readily available to plant roots is
World Geography.explanation: Capillary water is retained on the soil particles by surface forces. It is held so strongly that gravity cannot remove it from the soil particles. The molecules of capillary water are free and mobile and are present in a liquid state. Plant roots are able to absorb it. Capillary water is, therefore, also known as available water.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question:
Which of the following are true of matrilineal societies?
1. Newly married couple stays with the woman's parents.
2. As per the rules of inheritance, the property passes from mother to daughter.
3. Women play a dominant role in the family.
4. Examples of matrilineal societies are those of the Khasi and Jaintia tribes of Meghalaya.
Select the correct answer using the codes given below
World Geography.explanation: Matrilineal descent is a kinship system where a descent group traces its ancestral lineage via the maternal (uterine) side of the group. The property passes from mother to daughter. Women are dominant in the family. The examples of matrilineal societies are Khasi and Jaintia tribes of Meghalaya.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: Which one among the following is a sea without having a coastline?
World Geography.explanation: While all other seas in the world are defined at least in part by land boundaries, the Sargasso Sea is defined only by ocean currents. The Sargasso Sea does not have a coastline as it is located in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: The Circle of illumination divides Earth into two hemispheres known as
World Geography.explanation: The edge of the sunlit hemisphere forms a circular boundary separating the earth into a light half and a dark half.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: Which one among the following African countries is not landlocked?
World Geography.explanation: A landlocked country is a country entirely enclosed by land or whose only coastlines lie on closed seas. Angola is situated in Southern Africa, bordering the South Atlantic Ocean, between Namibia and Democratic Republic of the Congo.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: Satellite having the same orbital period as the period of rotation of the Earth about its ouwn axis is known as
World Geography.explanation: A geostationary satellite is an earth-orbiting satellite, placed at an altitude of approximately 35,800 kilometres (22,300 miles) directly over the equatorand revolves in the same direction as the earth rotates (west to east).

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question:
Statement I Southern part of France is famous for wine making industry.
Statement II Southern part of France produces a variety of fruits due to Mediterranean climate.
options: Both the statements are individually true and Statement II is the correct explanation of Statement I
Both the statements are individually true, but Statement II is not the correct explanation of Statement I
Statement I is true, but Statement II is false
Statement I is false, but Statement II is true
World Geography.answer: Both the statements are individually true and Statement II is the correct explanation of Statement I
World Geography.explanation: Numerous grape varieties are cultivated in France including both internationally wellknown and obscure local varieties.Hence, Southern part of France is famous for wine making industry.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: Which one among the following is responsible for formation of Ozone Holes' in the stratosphere?
World Geography.explanation: Chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) are nontoxic, nonflammable chemicals containing atoms of carbon, chlorine, and fluorine. They are used in the manufacture of aerosol sprays, blowing agents for foams and packing materials as solvents and as refrigerants. CFCs contribute to ozone depletion in the upper atmosphere.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: Albedo effect would be relatively higher in
World Geography.explanation: Albedo also varies according to the angle of incidence of the Sun Raysbeing higher for slating rays and lower for vertical or nearly vertical rays. From this we can derive that albedo will be relatively higher during early morning and late evening because at both times, Sun rays are slanting.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: Composite volcanic cone is also called strata cone because of the
options: alternating sheets of lava and pyroclastic materials
eruption of lava flow from a fissure
World Geography.answer: alternating sheets of lava and pyroclastic materials
World Geography.explanation: Composit volcano (Strato-volcano) is a volcanic cone built of alternating layers of Lava and Pyroclastic materials, over a lengthy time period.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: Cordillera in North America is a
World Geography.explanation: Cordilleras of North America is a part of the Cordilleran mountain system found in the western part of North America and extendingthrough the coterminous United States and Alaska, Canada, and Mexico.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: The humidity of air measured in percentage is called
World Geography.explanation:
The amount of water vapour in the air at any given time is usually less than that required to saturate the air. The relative humidity is the percent ofsaturation humidity, generally calculated in relation to saturated vapour density.
Relative Humidity = actual vapor density / saturation vapor density x100%

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: Chinook is a
options: tropical desert storm in West Asia
World Geography.explanation: Chinook is a warm, dry, gusty, westerly wind that blows down the Rocky Mountains in North America.

Indian Geography.subject: Indian Geography
Indian Geography.question: Amarkantak plateau in the Maikal hills marks the origin of the river
Indian Geography.explanation: The origin of the river is a tiny reservoir named as Narmada Kund which is situated on the Amarkantak Hill in Anuppur District of East Madhya Pradesh. Amarkantak region is a unique natural heritage area and is the meeting point of the Vindhyas and the Satpuras, with the Maikal Hills being the fulcrum.

Indian Geography.subject: Indian Geography
Indian Geography.question: Red soil colour is caused by
Indian Geography.explanation: Red soils develop in a warm, temperate, wet climate under deciduous forests and have thin organic and mineral layers overlying a yellowish-brown leached layer resting on red layer made of iron oxide(ferric oxide). Red soils generally form from iron-rich sediments. They are usually poor growing soils, low in nutrients and humus and difficult to cultivate.

Indian Geography.subject: Indian Geography
Indian Geography.question:
Which of the following statements about Nathu la Pass are correct?
1. It links Sikkim with Tibet.
2. It was the main artery of the ancient Silk Route.
3. It was reopened in the year 2006.
Select the correct answer using the codes given below
Indian Geography.explanation: Nathu La is a mountain pass in the Himalayas. It connects the Indian state of Sikkim with China's Tibet Autonomous Region. Nathu La is located on the 563 km Old Silk Route, an offshoot of the historic Silk Road. It was sealed by India after the 1962 Sino-Indian War and was re-opened in 2006 following numerous bilateral trade agreements.

Indian Geography.subject: Indian Geography
Indian Geography.question: Which one among the following is the correct sequence of the rivers from North to South?

Indian Geography.subject: Indian Geography
Indian Geography.question: Which one among the following states does not form part of the Narmada basin ?
Indian Geography.explanation: The Narmada River travels a distance of 1,312 km before it falls into Gulf of Cambay in the Arabian Sea near Bharuch in Gujarat. The first 1,079 km of its run is in Madhya Pradesh. In the next length of 35 km, the river forms the boundary between the States of Madhya Pradesh and Maharashtra. Again, in the next length of 39 km, it forms the boundarybetween Maharashtra and Gujarat.

Indian Geography.subject: Indian Geography
Indian Geography.question:
Consider the following sanctuaries of India
1. Periyar
2. Dachigam
3. Sariska
4. Kanha
Which one among the following is the correct sequence of location of the above sanctuaries from South to North?
Indian Geography.explanation:
Periyar National Park and Wildlife Sanctuary is a protected area in the districts of Idukki and Pathanamthitta in Kerala.
Kanha National Park is one of the tiger reserves of India and the largest national park of Madhya Pradesh.
The Sariska Tiger Reserve is an Indian national park located in the Alwar district of Rajasthan.
Dachigam National Park is located in Jammu and Kashmir.

Indian Geography.subject: Indian Geography
Indian Geography.question:
Statement I Typical laterite soils in India are generally fertile.
Statement II Laterite soils generally experience leaching.
options: Both the statements are individually true and Statement II is the correct explanation of Statement I
Both the statements are individually true, but Statement II is not the correct explanation of Statement I
Statement I is true, but Statement II is false
Statement I is false, but Statement II is true
Indian Geography.answer: Both the statements are individually true, but Statement II is not the correct explanation of Statement I
Indian Geography.explanation: Formation of lateritic soils due to weathering of rocks under humid tropical conditions consists of oxides of iron and aluminium. It is not fertile. Murrom and bricks are made from it. When dry it is harden, when rain it is clay. It is produced by large scale chemical weathering where silica and bases are leached from the parent material.

Indian Geography.subject: Indian Geography
Indian Geography.question:
Match the following
List I (Hydroelectric power station) List II (Location in map)
A. Nagarjuna Sagar
B. Mettur
C. Hirakund
D. Sileru

Indian Geography.subject: Indian Geography
Indian Geography.question: Why is Himalayan region poor in mineral resources?
options: Himalayan region is made up of crystalline rocks
Displacement of rock strata has disturbed the arrangement of rocks and made it complex.
The climatic conditions are not suitable for exploration of minerals
The rugged terrain makes exploration of minerals difficult and costly
Indian Geography.answer: Displacement of rock strata has disturbed the arrangement of rocks and made it complex.

Indian Geography.subject: Indian Geography
Indian Geography.question:
Which of the following are UNESCO recognised world heritage sites?
1. Caves of Ajanta.
2. Temple and Caves at Ellora.
3. Mandapas of Mahabalipurarn.
4. Caves of Kanheri.
Select the correct answer using the codes given below

Indian Geography.subject: Indian Geography
Indian Geography.question:
Match the following
List I (Industrial production) List II (Place of production)
A. Brassware 1. Kanchipuram
B. Silk Sarees 2. Lucknow
C. Chikkan Embroidery 3. Muradabad
D. Sports Goods 4. Jalandhar

Indian Geography.subject: Indian Geography
Indian Geography.question: Which one of the following dams is constructed across Krishna River?
Indian Geography.explanation: Srisailam Dam is the 2nd largest capacity hydroelectric project in the country. The dam is constructed across the Krishna River which flows in the Kurnool district of Andhra Pradesh.
